metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8628 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Ansible before version 2.2.0 fails to properly sanitize fact variables sentfrom the Ansible controller. An attacker with the ability to create specialvariables on the controller could execute arbitrary commands on Ansibleclients as the user Ansible runs as.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8628` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.0.0.2-2ubuntu1.1
ansible-fireball - 2.0.0.2-2ubuntu1.1
ansible-node-fireball - 2.0.0.2-2ubuntu1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ansible package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0.2-2ubuntu1.1').
